definition: Ni Guizhen or Ni Kwei-Tseng (1869 - 1931), mother of Song Ailing 宋藹齡|宋蔼龄[Song4 Ai3 ling2], Song Qingling 宋慶齡|宋庆龄[Song4 Qing4 ling2] and Song Meiling 宋美齡|宋美龄[Song4 Mei3 ling2]
Ni Sichong (1868-1924), general closely linked to Yuan Shikai 袁世凱|袁世凯 during his unsuccessful 1915 bid for Empire
to infer easily/to guess at a glance/to get a clue
impossible to get even an outline (idiom)/unfathomable/not a clue
Ni Kuang (1935-), Chinese novelist and screenwriter
Ni Tuosheng or Watchman Nee (1903-1972), influential Chinese Christian
Dionysus, the god of wine in Greek mythology

sentences.english: President Cao Xumin and Vice-president Ni Rulin attended the conference.
sentences.chinese: 曹緒岷會長，倪如林副會長出席了會議。

sentences.english: Ni's work has been exhibited in numerous solo and group exhibitions locally and internationally.
sentences.chinese: 倪海峯的作品在國內和國際上多次舉辦個展和羣展。

sentences.english: Ni draws hope from the unusual show of public solidarity.
sentences.chinese: 倪希望這次不尋常的會面能凝聚公衆團結。

sentences.english: Mr. Ni and engineer Mr. Zhang should understand if they will see these pictures.
sentences.chinese: 倪先生和張工程師如果看到這些照片應該明白。

definition: surname Pan/Pan, faun in Greek mythology, son of Hermes
first month of a season/eldest amongst brothers
surname Zou/vassal state during the Zhou Dynasty (1046-256 BC) in the southeast of Shandong Province
to gallop/to assist/to attack/to wade/great/old variant of 憑|凭[ping2]
barley/to moo/to seek or obtain/old variant of 侔[mou2]/old variant of 眸[mou2]
Zheng state during the Warring States period/surname Zheng/abbr. for 鄭州|郑州[Zheng4 zhou1]
